alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 31 at 3:50AM MST until January 01 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of one to three feet. The heaviest snow will fall on the southwest slopes. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Feet. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible, especially over Wolf Creek Pass. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 15 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft
